title: Can we have an ap black cleaver

replies.body: Abyssal?

Which is important because {{item:3071}} by itself enables teamcomps of 4 AD + support, as long as enemies don't have Malphie and/or Rammy.

Meanwhile lack of "Magic Cleaver" means that 3 magic damage dealers in team often is already far too much.
pure AP comp would never work anyways because they do not generally do enough damage to towers, so they can't push as hard. Could only see very specific comps as being possible.

{{item:3001}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3151}} Gives some crazy penetration, along with a decent chunk of ap.  Adding {{item:3116}} and another ap item makes me a crazy mage, with some decent tank.  Ive seen some spells do upwards of 1000 damage, since no one in bronze knows to build mr against mages.
God no.

I main AP and I'll be the first one to say we don't need a black cleaver equivalent for magic damage. Black Cleaver is meant to be a way to soften up tanks primarily used by fighters (and abused by ADCs) the vast majority of magic damage champions are meant to be used as either burst damage dealers or zone control providers. Most of them should not be able to kill tanks that defeats the whole purpose. 

For those that are specifically meant to deal continuous damage like Cassi and Swain (that's the only two that come to mind) the combination of Linadri's and DFT is by far more than enough.
